plugins.name: CVA: Component Variants Automator
plugins.description:
It's time to save you some time!

Don't take "authority" too seriously, we are here to give you control!


With CVA you'll get to control how you want your components to vary without having to modify each variant by hand.


For now, if you create your component using the Cascading Components strategy you get to generate a Component Set with all possible variants. That's pretty useful to quickly check how your component will look and to document your design system.


You can also limit the number of generations by linking properties therefore avoiding generating a big button with a tiny text, for example.


🛝 Go to our playground to learn how to use CVA step by step!

🍿 Learn how to use CVA from our tutorial on Youtube.


We are in a lot of places, follow us on 🕵️

Instagram for tips 🧚

Twitter / X for updates 📣

Medium for some reading 📖

Youtube for tutorials 👩‍🏫

Discord for befriending us 🧞‍♂️

And please, ask for features and feedback on cva.canny.io 📮


But we are just starting and there's a lot more to come. We keep working to bring you more straightforward solutions for your designing needs, cause less clicks means more time for your creativity to flourish.


🕵️ PS: Our name is a reference to TVA, the Time Variance Authority. If you haven't watched the TV show Loki to get the reference, we highly recommend it!

plugins.name: Token Studio Inspect
plugins.description:
Token Studio Inspect is a Figma plugin enabling users to generate tokens in the Inspect panel natively. It adds tokens to component descriptions, making it easy to inspect, select, and copy them. Tokens Studio Inspect detects token data from the Tokens Studio Figma Plugin. If no data is available, nothing is added to the component description.


Key features:

  • Generate tokens studio inspect. It will add token data to all components detected in files based on the tokens you apply in the component.
  • Delete tokens studio inspect. It will erase all token data from the component description of all components detected in the files.


Demo:

Watch the demo video here.


Limitation:

Tokens Studio can be applied to any layer in Figma. However, Tokens Studio Inspect are limited to components only, as Figma only allows descriptions within components.
plugins.tagline: Generate Tokens Studio inspect natively in Figma’s inspect panel

plugins.name: SVG Auto Fix Path Directions (fill-rule)
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin to fix path directions, commonly named 'fill-rule' and 'winding order' in Figma.

You can use your existing export config, this plugin will export files to every format to a single ZIP file. It will also warn if files are duplicated because they have the same name.


This plugin is still in beta and is not tested for every usecase. If you have any bugs please get in touch :)


There isn't any customization yet. It uses the default SVGO fixes.




Source code is available at https://github.com/RemyyB/Figma-Plugin-FixPathDirections, feel free to update the plugin and tweak it, I do accept PR's. I am tweaking this plugin, it is still in beta, but don't expect a feature-rich plugin just yet.
plugins.tagline: A very simple plugin to fix path directions in Figma. Includes SVGO and exports into a ZIP file.

plugins.description:
Are you tired of the endless back-and-forth between designers and developers, desperately seeking a way to accelerate your design system creation process? Look no further! UICE is here to revolutionize your workflow, making design system development a breeze. With this groundbreaking plugin, you can now slash your design system building time to just 1/10 of what it used to be, ensuring a smoother, more efficient collaboration between your design and development teams.


🚀 Unlock Effortless Efficiency: UICE is your secret weapon for reducing friction between designers and devs. It's a game-changer, streamlining your workflow and supercharging your design system development.


🌟 Top-Notch User Experiences, Effortlessly: UICE empowers you to deliver top-notch user experiences to your end-users with ease. Our revolutionary tool bridges the gap between design and development, ensuring your project stands out in the crowded digital landscape.


🔥 Key Features that Set UICE Apart:

  1. Automated UI Component Extraction: UICE is like having a magical genie at your service. It automatically extracts UI components from your Figma designs, eliminating the need for tedious, manual labor.
  2. Lightning-Fast Integration: Export your Figma designs to React components in a matter of seconds. UICE accelerates your project's progress, making it a turbocharged experience.
  3. Enhanced Collaboration: UICE fosters seamless collaboration between your design and development teams, helping them work in harmony and deliver exceptional results.
  4. Pixel-Perfect Consistency: Ensure pixel-perfect consistency throughout your project, preserving the design integrity from Figma to the final product.
  5. Time Savings Beyond Belief: With UICE, you can now devote your time to more creative tasks, knowing that the design system generation is in capable hands. Say goodbye to wasted hours and hello to productivity.


UICE isn't just a design system generator; it's a catalyst for success. Experience the future of design system development with UICE, and watch your projects flourish like never before. Say farewell to inefficiencies and embrace the fast track to design system perfection!

plugins.name: Interface Architecture (IA)
plugins.description:
Interface Architecture (IA) is a lightweight Figma plugin that lets users tag, organize, and share designs in a central repository for quick discovery and reuse across multiple files. Create nested folders to structure your product, save important frames/sections/components for quick reference, and share them effortlessly with your team.


The plugin streamlines your workflow by allowing you to save any Figma frame with a simple copy-paste of its URL. Each frame can be previewed directly within the plugin, making it easy to find and reference specific designs without switching between files.


Free users can get started with 10 folders and 25 frames, perfect for individual use or small teams. For unlimited storage and advanced features, upgrade to our Pro plan.


Getting started is simple: Install the plugin, create an account, and begin organizing your frames into custom folders. Use Command + L (⌘L) to copy any frame's URL, then paste it into the plugin to save it. Search functionality helps you quickly locate frames across all your folders.


Perfect for:

• Design system management

• Component libraries

• Project documentation

• Team collaboration

• Design reviews


Pro features include:

• Unlimited folders and frames

• Priority support

• More features coming soon

accepted.name: Matt Giorgio
accepted.description: Software Designer based in Adelaide, Australia

plugins.tagline: Tag, organize & share designs in a central repository for quick discovery and reuse across files.

plugins.name: Design Tokens (W3C) Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports Figma Variable collections into separate JSON files (with variables grouped by modes) in a .zip file for easy download. The files are formatted according to the Design Tokens spec defined by the Web 3 Working Group.


This standard can be consumed by tools such as Style Dictionary to parse your Figma Variables into variables that can be used in your code directly, across different stacks.


Documentation and usage details can be found in the GitHub repository.

plugins.name: Figma Font Filter
plugins.description:
The Figma Font Filter plugin simplifies font selection and management in your Figma projects. Here's what it does:

  1. Find the most popular Google Fonts
  2. Filter by stroke, style (serif, sans-serif, etc.), or language, amongst other features
  3. Sort by popularity, what's trending, newest, or alphabetically
  4. Change the font size to preview how it looks
  5. Compare different fonts side-by-side
  6. Save your favourite fonts for easy access later, across projects
  7. Apply fonts to one or more Figma text layers with a single click


This plugin is useful for designers who want to speed up their font selection process. It helps you find, test, and use the right fonts for your designs without leaving Figma. Whether you're working on a new project or updating an existing one, the Figma Font Filter makes dealing with fonts easier and faster.


More about us? Visit cadre.pt.
plugins.tagline: Optimize your Figma font selection: discover, compare, favorite, and apply typefaces with ease

plugins.name: IconLab - Simplify Your Icons
plugins.description:
IconLab: Simplify, Flatten, and Unify Your Icons


What is IconLab?

IconLab is a powerful Figma plugin designed to clean up and optimize your icons with ease. It simplifies, merges, and standardizes layers, helping you maintain an efficient and organized design workflow. Whether you're working with complex icon sets or refining a design system, IconLab ensures your icons are clean, lightweight, and production-ready.


What does it do?

IconLab offers a set of intelligent automation tools to refine and simplify your icons:

  1. Remove unnecessary groups and frames – Eliminates redundant frames, groups, and nested structures for a cleaner design.
  2. Merge all layers into one – Combines multiple fills and strokes into a single optimized layer.
  3. Remove extra nodes – Cleans up redundant vector points without affecting the shape of your icon.
  4. Standardize names and colors – Ensures all icons have consistent names and colors for a uniform design system.
  5. Ensure proper scaling – Ensures every icon is a single, properly scaled layer.
  6. Remove placeholder layers – Detects and deletes unnecessary 24x24 placeholder rectangles often found in icon packs.


Who is it for?

IconLab is built for:

  1. UI/UX Designers – Quickly flatten and optimize icons for better usability.
  2. DesignOps & Design System Managers – Maintain consistency across projects with standardized icon structures.


Why Use IconLab?

  1. 🚀 Save Time – Automate repetitive tasks and focus on design.
  2. 🎨 Keep Files Clean – Keep your Figma workspace structured and clutter-free.
  3. ⚡ Boost Performance – Lighter files result in faster Figma workflows.
  4. 🔄 Iterate Faster – Simplified layers make editing and exporting effortless.


How Does It Work?

Simply select your icons in Figma and run IconLab. The plugin will automatically simplify, merge, and clean up your layers—no manual adjustments needed.

121610.name: IconLab - Simplify Your Icons
121610.description:
IconLab: Simplify, Flatten, and Unify Your Icons


What is IconLab?

IconLab is a powerful Figma plugin designed to clean up and optimize your icons with ease. It simplifies, merges, and standardizes layers, helping you maintain an efficient and organized design workflow. Whether you're working with complex icon sets or refining a design system, IconLab ensures your icons are clean, lightweight, and production-ready.


What does it do?

IconLab offers a set of intelligent automation tools to refine and simplify your icons:

  1. Remove unnecessary groups and frames – Eliminates redundant frames, groups, and nested structures for a cleaner design.
  2. Merge all layers into one – Combines multiple fills and strokes into a single optimized layer.
  3. Remove extra nodes – Cleans up redundant vector points without affecting the shape of your icon.
  4. Standardize names and colors – Ensures all icons have consistent names and colors for a uniform design system.
  5. Ensure proper scaling – Ensures every icon is a single, properly scaled layer.
  6. Remove placeholder layers – Detects and deletes unnecessary 24x24 placeholder rectangles often found in icon packs.


Who is it for?

IconLab is built for:

  1. UI/UX Designers – Quickly flatten and optimize icons for better usability.
  2. DesignOps & Design System Managers – Maintain consistency across projects with standardized icon structures.


Why Use IconLab?

  1. 🚀 Save Time – Automate repetitive tasks and focus on design.
  2. 🎨 Keep Files Clean – Keep your Figma workspace structured and clutter-free.
  3. ⚡ Boost Performance – Lighter files result in faster Figma workflows.
  4. 🔄 Iterate Faster – Simplified layers make editing and exporting effortless.


How Does It Work?

Simply select your icons in Figma and run IconLab. The plugin will automatically simplify, merge, and clean up your layers—no manual adjustments needed.


If you have any feedback or suggestions about the plugin, please feel free to email me so we can improve it. Your input is greatly appreciated!

plugins.name: Markdown 文字转化
plugins.description:
该插件可以识别 Markdown 的标题（以 # 开头的行）和普通文本，按照预设的字体、字号、颜色等样式在 Figma 中创建相应的文本框。转化后的文本框会被自动组织成一个 Auto Layout，方便排版和布局。


如果 Markdown 文本中存在多个标题，插件会自动将标题和相应的文本组成一个小的 Auto Layout，多个小的 Auto Layout 又会组成一个大的 Auto Layout。此外，如果文本中存在多个段落，插件会自动将它们拆分为多个文本图层。


该插件现已支持主题：黑色文字和白色文字。你可以根据需要选择合适的主题，插件会根据选择的主题设置文本的样式。


该插件先已支持ChatGPT，你可以使用自己的api key 先润色文案，再转化样式


This plugin supports recognizing Markdown headings (lines starting with "#") and regular text, creating corresponding text boxes in Figma with preset font, font size, color, and other styles. The converted text boxes are automatically organized into an Auto Layout, facilitating layout and design.


If there are multiple headings in the Markdown text, the plugin automatically groups the headings and their respective text into a smaller Auto Layout, and multiple small Auto Layouts form a larger Auto Layout. Additionally, if there are multiple paragraphs in the text, the plugin automatically splits them into separate text layers.


The plugin also offers two themes: Dark Text and Light Text. You can choose the appropriate theme, and the plugin will set the text styles accordingly based on your selection.


This plugin already supports ChatGPT. You can use your own API key to refine the text and then convert the style.
plugins.tagline: 将Figma中的文本图层转化为特定的autolayout的文本样式

plugins.name: Mediaweb Color Switcher
plugins.description:
Mediaweb Color Switcher is a simple plugin that allows you to search any color code on the whole artboard or object selection and replace it for another code or color style.

Simply select the color you want to switch and either select a previously created color style or an entirely new color, using its hexadecimal color code. You can then apply the new color to fills and/or strokes and select between different object types.

This is the missing color switcher feature for your next project and can help you speed up your design process.

plugins.name: QML Style Export
plugins.description:
Overview

A Figma plugin that converts selected Figma elements into QML code, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma designs and Qt/QML development.


Supported Elements

- Frames: Converts to QML `Item` or `Rectangle` with layout properties

- Components: Generates reusable QML components with variant support

- Component Instances: Handles component instantiation with property overrides

- Rectangles* Converts to QML `Rectangle` with styling properties

- Text: Converts to QML `Text` with font properties

- Ellipses: Converts to QML shape elements


Styling Properties

- Colors (fill and stroke)

- Dimensions (width and height)

- Border properties

- Corner radius

- Opacity

- Visibility

- Drop shadows

- Font properties

- Gradients


Layout Support

- Auto-layout (horizontal and vertical)

- Spacing and padding

- Alignment properties

- Parent-child relationships

- Anchoring


Component Features

- Reusable component generation

- Variant handling through states

- Property overrides

- Nested component support


Usage

1. Select Elements

- Select one or more elements in your Figma design

2. Export QML

- Click the "Export QML" button

- The generated QML code appears in the textarea

3. Clear Output

- Use the "Clear" button to reset the output area


Integration

The generated QML code can be directly used in Qt projects, maintaining the visual fidelity of the Figma designs while following Qt best practices and conventions.
plugins.tagline: Converts selected Figma elements into QML, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures

plugins.name: Add Multiple Pages
plugins.description:
Supercharge your Figma workflow with the Add Multiple Pages plugin! This powerful tool allows you to create and organize multiple pages in your Figma file with just a few clicks.


Key Features:

  1. Bulk page creation: Generate multiple pages instantly
  2. Flexible input: Enter the number of pages or specify custom page names
  3. Auto-naming: Pages are sequentially named for easy organization
  4. Time-saver: Eliminate repetitive manual page creation


How to Use:

  1. Open the plugin Add Multiple Pages in your Figma file
  2. Enter the desired number of pages or list custom page names (comma-separated)
  3. Click Create Pages and watch your file structure grow!


Perfect for designers, project managers, and anyone looking to streamline their Figma file organization. Say goodbye to tedious page creation and hello to enhanced productivity with Add Multiple Pages!

plugins.name: Suggested Links
plugins.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a predictive model to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


Due to the costs involved in deploying the necessary predictive models, the plugin only functions properly when a custom backend URL pointing to an appropriate backend is provided. A template for such a backend is linked below.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Predicting Links for Mobile GUI Prototyping" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Prof. Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([backend](https://github.com/christophajohns/figma-plugin-backend), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links)).

accepted.name: Christoph Johns
accepted.description: MSc Human-Computer Interaction and Design @ KTH/Aalto

plugins.name: Design-to-Motion Generator
plugins.description:
Design to Motion - Animate Figma Elements to GIF By Yashitech Solutions

Design to Motion is a powerful animation plugin that converts your static Figma designs into engaging animated GIFs effortlessly. Perfect for creating design presentations, demos, and social media content.

Key Features:

  1. Multiple Animation Types: Fade, slide, scale, rotate, and bounce effects
  2. Customizable Settings: Control duration, delay, easing, and direction
  3. High-Quality Exports: Export GIFs in various qualities up to 1080p
  4. Flexible FPS Options: Select between 24, 30, or 60 fps
  5. Background Color Control: Customize animation background
  6. Preview & Reset: Test animations before exporting
  7. Batch Processing: Animate multiple elements at once
  8. Smart SVG Handling: Optimized processing for better performance


Perfect for:

  1. UI/UX Designers
  2. Product Designers
  3. Marketing Teams
  4. Design Presentations
  5. Social Media Content
  6. Product Demos
  7. Design Documentation
  8. Interactive Prototypes


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to animate
  2. Click "Scan Selection" to import them
  3. Choose your animation settings
  4. Preview the animation
  5. Export as GIF in your desired quality


Technical Specifications:

  1. Multiple export qualities (400p to 1080p)
  2. Variable frame rates (24-60 fps)
  3. Optimized SVG processing
  4. Batch element processing
  5. Smart memory management


Note: This plugin is part of the Yashitech plugin suite, along with HTML to Figma and Figma Inspect Styles.
plugins.tagline: Figma designs into smooth animated GIFs with customizable effects, transitions, and high-quality.

This plugin aims to bridge the gap between data and design by providing an effortless way to transform raw JSON data into beautiful, customizable design elements within Figma.

Whether you're a designer working with data-driven content or a developer looking to visualize JSON data, JSON to Design Wizard is the perfect tool to enhance your workflow and boost your creativity.

Key Features:

Easy JSON Import: Import JSON data directly from a file or paste it into the built-in JSON editor.
Customizable Templates: Choose from a variety of pre-built design templates or create your own to match your project's unique style.
Dynamic Data Binding: Link JSON data to design elements, making it easy to update your designs when your data changes.
Auto-Layout & Responsive Design: Automatically arrange and resize design elements based on your JSON data, ensuring clean and responsive designs.

plugins.name: Wormhole
plugins.description:
Convert Figma icons to Android Studio with one click

Brief description:

This Figma plugin facilitates the process of transferring icons from Figma to Android Studio, allowing developers to quickly incorporate their designs into their Android projects. By reducing potential errors and inconsistencies caused by incompatible file formats, this plugin can significantly improve developers' efficiency and reduce delivery time.

Main features:

  • Convert Figma icons to Android Studio-compatible formats
  • Import icons into Android Studio with one click

Use cases:

  • When UI designs in Android apps need to be updated based on design updates and require frequently syncing icons from Figma to their projects.

Instructions:

  • The plugin accesses a user's Figma and Android Studio project data, therefore the privacy and security of the user's information must be ensured.
  • The plugin must be able to automatically update to support the latest versions of Android Studio and Figma.
  • The plugin should provide clear instructions on how to configure the Android Studio project settings to utilize the converted icons.



demo video : https://youtu.be/N_EkWE9NdT0
plugins.tagline: one key deploy resource to android studio

plugins.name: Design System Adoption
plugins.description:
The Design System Adoption plugin by David Vera gives you the ability to scan your Figma files for an in-depth analysis of the design system usage in your files.


Key features:

  1. Scan individual frame, pages or entire files to get detailed insights into how components from your design system are being used.
  2. Visualize your design system adoption data with a donut chart, offering a quick, easy-to-understand overview of how well your design system is adopted across your designs.
  3. Dive deeper into your analysis by zooming into specific elements within your Figma file directly from the plugin, making it easier to inspect and refine your designs.
  4. Streamline your scans by ignoring hidden layers, recognizing text styles and grouping detached components for a more focused analysis.
  5. Export the data – perfect for reports, presentations, and deep dives!


See why top design leads rely on this plugin for actionable insights into their design system adoption. This plugin gives you the full picture of your design system adoption in just a few clicks!


How to use:

Run the plugin on your component library.

Go to the Library tab and click Connect Library. It may take a little while to link your library.

Open any design file and run the plugin.

Select a frame and hit "Analyze frame". Optional: "Analyze page or file".


Why you need this plugin:

Whether you’re leading a team, managing a design system, or striving for consistency, this plugin is essential for tracking how well your design system is adopted across projects.


Get actionable insights, drive consistency, and improve the quality of your designs.


David Vera is a Design System Lead based in Toronto

If you have an idea, need help or just want to chat about Design Systems? Email me at designsystemplugin@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Track, analyze, and improve your design system adoption

plugins.name: Sync artboards
plugins.description:
Are you using the same screen at multiple spots in the same Figma file across pages? Use this plugin to sync the latest updates to all other artboards with the same name. Make sure that the artboards are not inside any group or section.


How to use this plugin?

Step 1: Make sure that the artboards/frames you want to be in sync should have the exact same name

Step 2: Select 1 or more art board (frame) that has the latest updates

Step 3: Run the plugin and it will look for all other artboards with same name as the selected ones. Then it will replace them with the selected one


No more outdated artboards anywhere!
plugins.tagline: In single click, sync all other artboards with the same name to the selected art board!

plugins.name: Bloxporter
plugins.description:
Quickly Export UI Into Roblox


If you have not, obtain the free Roblox plugin here

Live support in this discord server


How to Use:

  1. Open the plugin
  2. Configure your project*
  3. Select the frame you want to export (check conditions)
  4. Click Export
  5. (If Applicable) Download images and unzip via 7zip, Import images onto Roblox, Insert into workspace
  6. Copy the JSON string
  7. Paste into the Roblox Plugin
  8. Click Import
  9. Note: Export hierarchy will be the same as the project hierarchy.


How to Activate License:

  1. Retrieve license key from GumRoad product page found here
  2. Copy license key into activation page
  3. Press ENTER/Unfocus to log in
  4. Note: License does not need to be reentered and can only be used once.


*Configuration Tags (apply to node name to modify exporting):

  1. _gray (exports as grayscale)
  2. _button (exports as a button, creates ImageButton for all except TEXT node->TextButton)
  3. _scroll (exports as a scrolling frame, only use on GROUP or FRAME node)
  4. _image (exports as an image, recommended to put VECTOR nodes in FRAME nodes with this tag to export as a single item)
  5. _lock (exports with UIAspectRatioConstraint)
  6. _ignore (ignores object when exporting)
  7. _parent (sets current object as the parent of all sibling objects while overriding the frame/group object is parented to)
  8. _clicked (makes buttons with the same base name change to that image when mouse down (in Roblox))
  9. _hover (makes buttons with the same base name change to that image when hovered (in Roblox))
  10. _toggled (makes buttons with the same base name change to that image when toggled (in Roblox))
  11. _disabled (makes buttons with the same base name change to that image when "Enabled" attribute is false (in Roblox))
  12. _abs (exports image as absolute size)
  13. _scrollx (makes scrolling frame scroll horizontally)
  14. _box (makes a textbox)
  15. Attaching "#" at the start of a node name will cause it to become an "icon". It is recommended to add this to nodes with the same image contents, as it will export a singular image and apply it to all of the icons to lower the amount of images needed to be uploaded.


Export Conditions:

  1. Selected must be a GROUP or FRAME node
  2. Parent must be "Layers"
plugins.tagline: Fastest Figma->Roblox Exporter

plugins.name: POD Quick Frame
plugins.description:
Multiple frames can be made in print on demand sizes.

Custom sized frames can also be made.


[One click frame Size]

Five frames are created with one click.

  1. Amazon Merch on Demand 4500x5400
  2. Printify 4200x4800
  3. PRINTFUL 3600x4800
  4. REDBUBBLE 7632x6480
  5. Instagram Reel 1080x1920


[Custom Size Usage]

  1. Enter the number of frames you want to create in Count. The default is 5.
  2. Arbitrary name for Frame Name. If not entered, it will be the name of the pixel size.
  3. Enter the pixel size for width and height. Finally, press the Create button. The default is 4500x5400.
plugins.tagline: Multiple frames can be made in print on demand sizes. Custom sized frames can also be made.

plugins.name: GeneXus Prototyper
plugins.description:
The GeneXus Prototyper plugin creates a fully functional application prototype based on your Figma design without relying on programmers to import it. You can experience and test the behavior of your design in a real app before sending it to the development team to continue the implementation of the business logic.


🚀 Effortless Prototyping

Generate a fully functional application prototype leveraging GeneXus technology and the Design Import tool.


✨ Designer Empowerment

Craft your design file without the need for programmers in the initial stages of the development cycle.


🛠️ Streamlined Workflow

Speed up the adjustment phase and prototype creation, making the development process efficient and frictionless.


☁️ Cloud Deployment

Get a sharable link to your prototype, ensuring accessibility from anywhere, anytime.


📱 Real App Evaluation

Test the behavior of your design in a real app using just your browser for Web and Angular generators or download the GeneXus Project Navigator for Android and Apple generators.


USAGE

Please refer to GeneXus Prototyper for Figma.


FAQ


Q: What is GeneXus?

A: GeneXus is a Low-Code Platform that automates the software development process, allowing developers to create applications for multiple platforms with reduced effort and time. Know more about us at GeneXus Website.


Q: Who is this plugin for?

A: For designers who have to adjust a design to be imported into the GeneXus platform.


Q: Is it free to use?

A: Yes. There are no in-app purchases when installing the plugin. You just have to create a GeneXus account to start using this powerful tool.


Q: Is the prototype result pixel-perfect?

A: The precision of the prototype depends on how organized, tidy, and clear your design is and how well you've applied the design guidelines, conventions and best practices we recommend while designing your application. Keep in mind that every design decision will impact the runtime result.


Q: Why I'm getting an error saying "Could not connect to the server at this moment" when trying to get logged in?

A: There might be temporary downtimes in our server for maintenance. Please be patient and retry using this plugin later.


SUPPORT


Your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions for improvement are welcome and highly valued. Connect with us at GeneXus Support.

accepted.name: GeneXus DesignOps Team
accepted.description: GeneXus workspace specialized in integrating design into GeneXus knowledge base.

plugins.tagline: A simple plugin for creating a fully functional app from a design file using GeneXus technology
